com.github.joschi.tinylog.gelf

Class GelfWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.joschi.tinylog.gelf.GelfWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.pmw.tinylog.writers.Writer

    public final class GelfWriter
extends Object
implements org.pmw.tinylog.writers.Writer
    A tinylog Writer writing log messages to a GELF-compatible server like Graylog2.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GelfWriter()
      Construct a new GelfWriter instance which logs to localhost on the default port (12201/udp) using an auto-detected local hostname.
      GelfWriter(String server)
      Construct a new GelfWriter instance.
      GelfWriter(String server, int port)
      Construct a new GelfWriter instance.

      Construct a new GelfWriter instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GelfWriter

        public GelfWriter(String server,
                  int port,
                  org.graylog2.gelfclient.GelfTransports transport,
                  String hostname,
                  Set<org.pmw.tinylog.writers.LogEntryValue> requiredLogEntryValues,
                  Map<String,Object> staticFields,
                  int queueSize,
                  int connectTimeout,
                  int reconnectDelay,
                  int sendBufferSize,
                  boolean tcpNoDelay)
        Construct a new GelfWriter instance.
        Parameters:
        server - the hostname of the GELF-compatible server
        port - the port of the GELF-compatible server
        transport - the transport protocol to use
        hostname - the hostname of the application
        requiredLogEntryValues - additional information for log messages, see LogEntryValue
        staticFields - additional static fields for the GELF messages
        queueSize - the size of the internal queue the GELF client is using
        connectTimeout - the connection timeout for TCP connections in milliseconds
        reconnectDelay - the time to wait between reconnects in milliseconds
        sendBufferSize - the size of the socket send buffer in bytes; a value of -1 deactivates the socket send buffer.
        tcpNoDelay - true if Nagle's algorithm should used for TCP connections, false otherwise

        public GelfWriter(String server,
                  int port,
                  String transport,
                  String hostname,
                  String[] additionalLogEntryValues,
                  String[] staticFields)
        Construct a new GelfWriter instance.
        Parameters:
        server - the hostname of the GELF-compatible server
        port - the port of the GELF-compatible server
        transport - the transport protocol to use
        hostname - the hostname of the application
        additionalLogEntryValues - additional information for log messages, see LogEntryValue
        staticFields - a list of additional static fields for the GELF messages (key-value-delimiter is ':')

      • GelfWriter

        public GelfWriter(String server,
                  int port,
                  String transport,
                  String hostname,
                  String[] additionalLogEntryValues,
                  String[] staticFields,
                  int queueSize,
                  int connectTimeout,
                  int reconnectDelay,
                  int sendBufferSize,
                  boolean tcpNoDelay)
        Construct a new GelfWriter instance.
        Parameters:
        server - the hostname of the GELF-compatible server
        port - the port of the GELF-compatible server
        transport - the transport protocol to use
        hostname - the hostname of the application
        additionalLogEntryValues - additional information for log messages, see LogEntryValue
        staticFields - a list of additional static fields for the GELF messages (key-value-delimiter is ':')
        queueSize - the size of the internal queue the GELF client is using
        connectTimeout - the connection timeout for TCP connections in milliseconds
        reconnectDelay - the time to wait between reconnects in milliseconds
        sendBufferSize - the size of the socket send buffer in bytes; a value of -1 deactivates the socket send buffer.
        tcpNoDelay - true if Nagle's algorithm should used for TCP connections, false otherwise
